comment: attendance does not matter however he does not release his PowerPoints so if you miss a class you miss a lot.

If you struggle with history professor Bailey will be great for you. He breaks everything down into vocab terms which helps a lot. It will require some effort to pass the tests but showing up and taking notes really helps. Attendance not required. Weekly discussion post and quiz. Make a weekly quizlet with the terms and you'll pass.

Pretty easy class, you just need to go to class and take detailed notes to be fine. The professor was nice, and his lectures usually ended before the class ended. There was a point-grading scale with weekly quizzes and discussion posts, but it was pretty forgiving. Would definitely take again.

Such a cool guy. Attendance taken only on Fridays for a discussion post. Weekly proctored quizzes with 3 exams. He does not post slides so I recommend going to class. Half of exams are an in person written portion and the other half is online with lockdown browser. Would recommend.

Attendance isn't necessarily but he doesn't post his notes. He highlights most of what will be on test/quizzes. Weekly assignments are discussion post and a 10 question quiz but they are pretty easy, 3 tests w/ lockdown browser. He's understanding and will go over anything you ask for. Must pay attention in class or you'll miss a lot of content

Prof. Bailey was great! You gotta show up to class though because he doesn't post any of his lectures on D2L. He is also a fast talker. You will have a weekly discussion plus a quiz. 3 exams online and lockdown + cam. Along with an in person short response portion and map knowledge for the 3 exams, 25 point extra credit . Very easy if you show up!!

weekly quiz and discussion post. Test have an in-person map portion + written portion but the multiple choice is online but has lockdown browser+ webcam.The written portion is the main complaint I hear but tbh he isn't going to just hand out the test questions, u have to study I have gotten As on everything just study the terms on quizlet!

His lectures are great and entertaining. Lockdown browser for everything. The majority of this class is studying every term and topic so it can be a lot. His exams are hard but the written portion is the worst. I can study all 200 terms in a unit have no idea or direction. It could be something he barely touched on so we're shocked when we see it.

He very passionate about what he teaches and it makes me kinda enjoy learning about history. The quizzes he posts every week are super easy if you pay attention in class and take notes. if you don't like to study a lot, don't take this class. The exams are around 4-5 modules so you need to study if you want to pass. Overall great professor!

Professor Bailey is my favorite professor that I have ever had! He is so caring and wants to get to know his students personally. His class is lecture-heavy, but it was a class where I feel I am really learning. He is very passionate about what he teaches, and I respect him very much! I am taking another class with him this semester.

I loved having Mr. Bailey as my professor. Tons of students in the class but he's still willing to reach out and work with you individually to make sure you're caught up. Definitely passionate about what he's teaching and everyone loves him. Quizzes do have a lockdown browser and you have to show up on fridays for an assignment.

This class is like if your cool uncle was your history professor. All material you learn is in the lectures so make sure to come to class. Weekly quizzes (lockdown) based on each week's material, in class discussion on Fridays, and 3 separate exams (last one is a final but not cumulative). Highly recommend him, he knows what hes talking about/doing
Kent Bailey is an amazing professor with very engaging lectures. As long as you show up to class you'll be fine. He does not post notes on D2L.

Professor Kent Bailey was a fantastic professor this semester. Attendance isn't required, but I recommend attending class to learn the right vocabulary for quizzes and exams. If you can't attend, you can request the PowerPoint, and he'll provide it with the key terms. Keep in mind that he's also juggling the challenges of teaching 400 students.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: Dr. Bailey is a super fun and understanding professor. He only takes attendance once a week, so missing a class doesn't break your grade. Weekly assignment can be done with a group, and there's an easy 10 question quiz per module. His lectures were engaging and comprehensive, and he connects well with his students. Totally recommend his class!

I wish he could teach me every subject! He cares about what he's teaching and his students and it shows through his lectures. I took this class as MWF so on MW he lectured and then F we did an in class discussion post and he took attendance. There are 3 equally weighted exams and he goes over the material the class before!

If you regularly attend class, there is no reason to get a bad grade. Ppl share notes since he doesn't post ppt and he is extremely sweet and passionate. Mon and Wed are lecture and Fri are for participation (10 pts) and you do a discussion question (super easy, total = 30 pts). Super easy A (tests/quizzes are basically vocab).

His lectures are very engaging and is he is such a kind person. There are quizzes and short paragraph discussion questions every week and very easy to do well on. It's overall a very straightforward course.

Professor Bailey runs a well-structured class. Quizzes and exams are challenging but fair. Attendance is a must to get the material. unstuck AI and the free textbook were super helpful for study prep.

Mr. Bailey is a good teacher. He makes the notes/PowerPoint very interesting. He is extremely interactive with his classes. There is a discussion post each Friday you can work in groups (it is the the only day that attendance is mandatory). You have one quiz due on Sunday which is super easy and short. 3 exams. STUDY and you will be good!

He's super nice and chill. Class is only mandatory whenever the weekly discussion is which is usually Fridays. Though he doesn't post any PowerPoints so coming to class would probably be in your best interest. Tests/weekly quizzes were pretty straight forward and fairly easy! Take his class for an easy A

Very important to attend lectures and take notes. The exams (he spreads out the exam into 3 parts) and quizzes are only based on the lectures. There's a book but it's not necessary. Overall he is very nice and respectful with great lectures.

Professor was okay, but I didn't like the class. You HAVE to be in class because he doesn't post the powerpoints. Actual notes are a bit vague. Easy discussion question and 10 question quiz every week. 3 tests, written (short-answer) & map portion, and then a multiple choice portion. Easy class, but if you take him, go to class. Don't be like me :/
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: There's an easy in-class module question due every week. There's a super easy weekly quiz. You have to be in class to get your notes cuz he doesn't post the PowerPoints. Half the test was online with 50 to 70 multiple choice questions but they were easy. Half was in person short answer questions with a map portion for the test but it was easy.

Attendance isn't mandatory but he doesn't post his lectures online. One discussion/small quiz a week and three tests total. As long you come to class and take notes you'll be completely fine, and his lectures are pretty interesting. He does make you guess which short answer he'll use on the written portion but its a good incentive to study.

Professor Bailey is such a nice guy and his lectures are really knowledgeable. I took him for MWF and he lectures on MW and then has a discussion post on Friday you have to be in class to get full credit for. The lectures aren't bad but he does not post PowerPoints so you will want to be there. Only 3 tests but if you go to class they aren't bad.

Gives weekly discussion questions but only 50 minutes to do them (have to be in class), so if you missed it then oh well. Exams have 3 parts (multiple choice, map, written portion) and the writing portion being 60 points, and the professor made it a guessing game instead of giving possible questions to study. Also did not post the powerpoints.

Professor Bailey was amazing. He gave weekly quizzes which were based on the lectures. They were lockdown browser and camera but 7-10 questions. Attendance is not mandatory but you can only get the material from his lectures. There are 3 exams that are 50-75 mc questions and written responses. He doesn't post the PowerPoints or offer extra credit.

I took him for HIST1111. He is very passionate and knows a lot about what he is teaching. He uses a powerpoint  to teach and it has all the words that are going to be on the quizzes/tests. He does not post this online so attendance is REQUIRED to pass. Quizzes/Tests have lockdown but are very easy if you wrote down notes in class. No extra credit.
He does not give extra credit, Evaluating your grade is hard. It might be too late to get an A.

Good professor for the most part, but he never allowed remakes for anything, so don't miss any assignments because he makes it hard for you to recover. The excuse he uses is that "it's just the way his gradebook is set up." He doesn't post PowerPoints so try not to miss any classes. He could be more lenient knowing that it's a gen ed class.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: I took him for Hist 1111. Dr. Bailey is a GREAT professor. You have one online quiz per week and one discussion question that he gives you the article for the whole week to look at. He is very kind and understanding when it comes to personal issues. If it helped my degree I would absolutely take another class of his. The nicest professor ever!

Lectures 2/3 days on the other day you do a discussion post then leave. Take half of the tests in person with written response and other half is mc on lockdown. one quiz a week which is also lockdown. test are very material heavy/can be hard so make sure you are paying attention/ studying. his class is not stressful but i feel there are easier.

Took his Hist 111 class, pretty simple class for the most part. I took it online. He only has 2 tests, even though they are on lock down browser they were still pretty simple. He also has a simple discussion board every week and a crossword puzzle. Simple class if you need an "A" take this class.  (preferably online)
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class--Online Savvy

comment: I took this class online and it really is not too bad! The tests and quizzes are lockdown browser but all of the information comes from the powerspoints. He grades pretty fast and gives good feedback on written positions. We had like three assignments every week but they were all pretty manageable.
Professor Bailey was awesome, but world history isnt my jam. My low grade was due to my struggle with the subject, but Professor Bailey was awesome!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Beware of pop quizzes--Test heavy

comment: He does not post his powerpoints and he also has pop quizzes for attendance. His tests are multiple choice but also has short essay questions, and you do not know which questions he asks until the actual day of the test and you have to label maps.

AMAZING PROFESSOR! Bailey makes lessons so interesting and made me care about history a lot more. Three tests over a LOT of terms, but if you study (quizlet's helped!) you will make A's. Weekly crosswords and discussions were not hard, just took a little time. He is brilliant with history and everything is so engrossing! Pop quizzes for attendance.

K. Bailey was a great professor, he does not post his lecture slides so you will need to go to class to get proper notes. He graded mainly on 3 tests, discussion posts, and crossword puzzles associated with that week's topics.
He is very passionate about what he teaches so he makes it easy to want to learn.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy

comment: I would definitely take Professor Bailey again! Very easy class. I highly recommended going to class. Do the Modules (very easy), and he is super caring about his class. He responds to emails quickly and always reminds the class multiple times about the upcoming assignments (he truly cares), overall a easy person to deal with.

He was very respectful and often expanded on topics related to his presentations. Even though attendance wasn't tracked, do go to class as he does not put presentations online, does not make study guides (as he lists what would be on the tests as yellow text), and would have "pop quizzes" to check the attendance.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Lecture heavy

comment: Simply class, lots of busy work. Weekly crossword puzzles/ quizzes/ discussions/map quizzes. Watch all the lectures & take notes on the highly key terms and all the assignments will be easy. The exams written portion was the only bad grades I got but I still passed with an A. Quizzes/Exams are timed on lockdown browser. Textbook was not needed.

By far one of the best online classes I have  taken at KSU.Well structured class with video recorded lectures from which all the testing materiel comes from. Very straight forward and easy class to pass.

Excellent teacher who cares about helping his students succeed. I failed the first exam  pretty bad.  It after going over the exam with me and reviewing my notes he gave me good feedback and suggestions to do better and in the end I pulled out an B. 3 exams with weekly discussion questions and a crossword puzzle.

History was never a subject I was very good at but I really enjoyed his style of teaching and his humor. He was always available before or after class to answer any questions I had concerning the material. I found the crossword puzzles fun.

he not great for extra help, when I came in with questions he was very critical and offered no support. you are mainly graded on 3 tests which include a TON of material. I was studying 9-11 pages of notes for each test. Tests are half in person, written portion and map, and half on full lockdown browser, 80 mc. Attendance is mandatory to take notes
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Professor Bailey isn't terrible,  his weekly assignments are easy, he doesn't post the ppts online and also does attendance by pop quizzes. His lectures also got distracting since he says the word actually even second he can. His test is 3 parts and has way too much information to study. The test has short answers, maps, and an online mc lockdown.

this teacher was very kind and very opened. the only type of "mandatory" attendance was these little pop-quizzes that he would have every other week in class. the weekly work was pretty easy. he was always available when you needed assistance. pretty chill teacher!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Beware of pop quizzes--Caring

comment: Prof. Bailey is funny and is always available outside of class and is willing to give feedback or look over quizlets to make sure they're accurate. He doesn't post notes, but he tells you exactly what is going to be on the tests. The outside of classwork is weekly discussion posts and crosswords, both of which are usually pretty easy.

He is a good professor and knowledgeable but he does not post the Powerpoints of lectures and he also goes through them VERY fast in class. Tests are hard because they consists of so many chapters in one, also a tough grader on the short response questions that are in class. There is no extra credit. Tests half in class and half lockdown at home.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy

comment: Professor Bailey is one of the best professors I've had this year. He's really funny and makes sure you understand what you need to study on his tests. There is a crossword puzzle and discussion post due every week ut they are relatively easy.

By far, the coolest professor I had since being here at Kennesaw State. He actually cares. The test aren't hard make sure to study for the first exam, because that is the hardest but if you study the words off the crossword puzzle you'll be fine on the rest of the test.

Professor Bailey is amazing. They are weekly discussion posts but they only take like 10 mins. The tests (there's 3) are fairly easy. As long as you take notes and study the night before, you should get a solid grade. I could get an A with only studying a day or two before the test. The lectures are boring but concise. Take notes and you'll do fine

Be prepared to go to class and take notes. He doesn't put any lecture materials online besides the weekly crossword puzzles and discussion questions, which didn't really have info that was on the test. Make a GroupMe or something and share notes if you do miss class. Only 3 tests (including final). 1/3 MC and other 2/3 maps, vocab and shrt answer
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: He doesn't post the slides so it's recommended that you go to class. He does Crossword puzzles which are like freebies and discussions which help you understand some of the things you need to know. Great lectures, very caring professor for sure.
Very good professor. Loved his class and highly recommend. Tears require a lot of studying and can be very hard but he cares very much about our grade

There's 3 test Exam 1,2,3. Gives you a multiple-choice exam which is pretty fair and easy if you study, however, he gives you a written portion that is weighted heavily. I studied for days and scored well on MC but failed the written. Doesn't give PP's to review or a study guide. He's a cool and nice dude, but id rather have another prof.

I don't care for history but Bailey made it so easy and to learn. Each module has around 3-7 lecture videos but none longer than around 15 minutes each. Quizzes and exams come directly from the highlighted portions of the PowerPoints. Exams include 5 "essay" questions, most of which are opinion based. He wants his students to succeed TAKE HIM!!!!!

Prof Bailey was great in every aspect except the exams. The only thing that was bad was he gives you 50 mins to complete a 75 question exam. On top of that, he gives you this exam to do on top of your regular weekly assignments (usually quizzes, discussion posts, lecture videos). He also gives you 5 short answer questions to complete (not timed).

I hate history, but Professor Bailey made this class extremely easy! He stresses what you need to know by highlighting important terms in yellow. Each week there were discussions, lecture videos,crossword puzzle, map and lecture quiz. All very easy. The only thing I didn't like was having to take an exam and do a whole new module in the same week.

DONT LET THE WEEKLY MODULE WORK LOAD FOOL YOU- he is an amazing teacher with easy assignments. Every lecture has "highlighted" key terms that he flat out tells you will be on the exams and quizzes. You are never surprised going into an exam or quiz becuase you know exactly what's on it! TAKE HIM.

Honestly, a great professor who is extremely passionate about his course. His lectures are straightforward, just make sure you pay attention to what's in yellow. Same procedure every week and his exams are pretty easy. The MCs are long but very easy to pass. If you're not a history person like me, I highly recommend Professor Bailey!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: Each week is pretty repetitive. Crossword puzzle, map quiz (no lockdown browser), easy discussion post, lecture quiz (can easily do by glancing over PowerPoint, important things to know are highlighted, is on lockdown with webcam). 3 tests. Test 3 is the final and not cumulative. Pretty simple tests similar to quizzes. Half of test is free response

Took fully online. Sincerely deserves a 5. Super responsive and I could do the work for the whole week in one day. He doesn't try to trick you on tests/quizzes-simply study those important terms. Finished with an A. I would say this is an easy A! FULLY RECOMMEND
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class--Lecture heavy

comment: He was a great professor. His syllabus and coursework is very straightforward. As long as you pay attention to lecture, study what he tells you, and do your work on time you will get an A in the class. Highly recommend him for this history course. Textbook is strongly recommended but his lectures are thorough enough to not need it.

Even though work is all laid out and organized y him on d2l, it is. A LOT of work. the test are 75 questions and then you have 5 exam essay questions to answer. If you have a job and are doing school full time, I do Not recommend taking his class. Everything is online and he gives a lot of stuff to do.

I'm taking him fall semester of 2020 and it is online. The workload is VERY heavy like be prepared to spend hours doing his stuff. Once he assigned 11 lecture videos in ONE week as well as a 75 question exam in the SAME week with more work to go along with it. He's one of those professors that thinks online means more work so good luck.

Loved him at Chattahoochee Technical College. Took him for 2 History Classes. I wish I could have taken him when I got to Kennesaw State University. He is a great man! Go to class so you dont miss pop quizzes!
Tough course

Professor Bailey is awesome. He is extremely organized in terms of how his course material is laid out. Better than any online class I've ever taken. He also teaches history like he's telling a story. I'm not super into history but I enjoyed his lectures quite a bit. Super quick grader and grading criteria is crystal clear. Don't need textbook.

Easy class. Tests and quizzes are taken straight from the lectures--didn't open the textbook once. Professor Bailey grades assignments very quickly, and he typically responds to emails within a day. He's super organized (which makes a world of difference, especially in an online class) and just an overall nice guy.

Great prof! 10 pop quizzes, just show up to class! 3 tests that are multiple choice and written response. Take notes during class and you will be just fine. There is also a discussion post due every week, but they aren't hard. He's a really nice and funny guy who wants you to do well.

Professor Bailey's class was definitely an easy A. You have to go to class to get the notes but his lectures were very easy to follow. 3 exams, no "final". He likes to do "pop quizzes" every now and then where you write your name on a piece of paper and get a 100. He highlights the points in the lecture that you need to focus on for the exams.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: Just go to class, take notes, and you will be fine! He has two-part tests (terms multiple-choice section and short essay) and its not as bad as you think. He will answer any questions you have. Weekly reading/discussion assignment which as long as you answer the question is an easy 100. I don't get why you wouldn't take him
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Beware of pop quizzes--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Professor Bailey was an easy teacher, everything in the class is straightforward. Discussion question every week , 3 test and an extra credit assignment. Do the extra credit assignment !!!! Dont miss any of the discussions questions . Random Pop quizzes about 5 and be in class the day after the test, he likes to do a pop quiz then.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy

comment: Here's the most important thing: Prof. Bailey does not upload his lecture slides to d2l, so you have to show up to class to get the material! Additionally, he says that everything on the test will be what was on the slides, but so many of the test questions came out of nowhere! also says class isn't mandatory yet does popquizzes based on attendance
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy

comment: I'm not a fan of History classes, but Prof. Bailey made it interesting. You have to attend class to take the notes he provides. Tests are multiple quest. and short answers combined. Take good notes, study those notes, pass the class! He's a down-to-earth, cool Professor. You can tell it's his passion.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: He really knows his stuff and is funny within the lectures. He is very knowledgeable. I gave him a 3 just because he doesnt post any notes online so you have to go to class in order to get the notes and the tests can be very hard. He does random pop quizzes about once a week which is just to check attendance.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: His lectures are great; he is clearly really passionate about history. His PowerPoints are not online, but as long as you attend class and take good notes, you should be fine. His PowerPoints specify which terms and short-answer questions are on the tests. Pop quizzes are just your name on a sheet of paper for attendance. Textbook wasn't necessary.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: His pop quizzes are your attendance that day. He will randomly just say pull out a sheet of paper and write your name, and you will receive a 100 for an assignment. I loved all the content and tests are so straight forward and easy. His powerpoints and lectures are so detailed that you don't even need the textbook. Loved him

He lectures every class period, but he keeps it very interesting. Attendance is not mandatory, but it is important to go because his powerpoints highlight every word that you need to study for the exam. A few times throughout the semester he does pop quizzes to take attendance, so that is another reason to be sure to go. I highly recommend him.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: His lectures are very long and he is fast pace, but you learn a lot of information. Be sure to take notes and highlight the words he tells you to. The tests are so easy and there are many quizlets for his class out there. He has pop quizzes, but it's just to write your name and get credit. The only annoying thing is discussion posts every Sunday.
rating_tags: BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--Clear grading criteria--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: He's really cool, I would be late to tests (by accident) and he would still let me take them. He makes lectures fun and I was always engaged in his class. It's definitely important to show up, he doesn't post lectures online and his powerpoints are just bullet points. Show up and do the discussions and you'll do well.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious--Amazing lectures

comment: His lectures are interesting and he teaches exactly what he expects you to know for the tests. He assigns a one page reading response each week. Since he doesn't put his lectures on d2l, you'll want to take notes and go to all the classes. I would definitely recommend taking his class.

He is an interesting man, with an interesting perspective. In his lectures he tells you the terms to watch out for that will be on the tests. I failed the first test horribly, but once I figured out his tests I got better. Just come to class and talk with the students around you. The Groupme is the reason I passed the class.

He is so worried about people cheating his class that he makes the tests harder. There is also a free response part that's ten questions and its sooo hard. He really made this class harder for all of us because he didn't want us to cheat. He has random pop quizzes which are a big part of your grade. So much material to study for such a small test.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--TEST HEAVY

comment: amazing professor and very passionate about history. pop quizzes are simply attendance every one in a while. discussion posts due every sunday but not diffuclt at all, 15 in total throughout the semester. his powerpoints are not posted online so you have to go to class to get notes. one extra credit assignment and 4 tests including the final.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: no bad comments, great guy and teacher

his pop quizzes are attendance, you write your name on a piece of paper to say you were in class and that would be the pop quiz. so just make sure you are there at the end of class to turn in the paper. He is a great guy and really passionate about history, but his tests are very hard and he does a lot of trick questions.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: Lecture heavy, caring, graded by few things, one extra credit assignment
rating_tags: BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--Clear grading criteria--Hilarious

comment: Professor Bailey does everything possible to help you succeed. He does lecture all class and every class, but his test come straight from the lecture. The tests are very straight forward and he does not try to trick you. He also allows you to do the weekly discussion post until you get an 100%. He gives you ample opportunity to do well. TAKE HIM!

Take this guy. Very lecture heavy but he makes it interesting and fun. The dude is hilarious and knows his stuff. Attendance counts towards the grade. 4 tests, non cumulative. would take him again to just be in his class.

He does a great job teaching, he is enjoyable to listen to and is really passionate about history. Feel free to talk to him because he is also a really nice person. The class is not a gimme, but take notes and study them well and you can get an A.

Professor Bailey is amazing! You have to go to class in order to do well but his lectures are interesting and he is so knowledgable. He is easy to contact and he's always willing to help you in whatever way he can. He wants all his students to be successful. If you go to class and take good notes, it will be easy.

Professor Bailey keeps his lectures interesting for how long the class period is. There are 4 tests (the last one is the final) and a discussion post every week. His tests were straightforward. I would definitely recommend him.

Kent Bailey is an AWESOME professor. He is so caring and helpful, and is such a great teacher. I had to miss the first written portion of the exam due to work, and he was so willing to reschedule a time for me to take it. He is so caring, passionate, and knowledgeable. I don't like history, but I thoroughly enjoyed his course this semester.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria

comment: Go to class. All he does is lecture he gives occasional pop quizzes based on attendance. His tests are online and somewhat tricky so you have to study. He gives a weekly discussion assignment based on a reading that he provides. Discussion is pretty easy and does not have to be formal. It is easy to pass as long as you take notes and pay attention.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Very helpful if you ever need clarification but make sure to do the weekly discussion questions that maybe take 30 min each. You need to attend each lecture bc he doesn't put up study guides, but you won't need a book if you do. Just make sure you take good notes and ignore how many times he uses the words "basically" and "actually".
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Inspirational--TEST HEAVY

comment: he's a great professor, don't sleep on him. Attendance isn't mandatory, but it's in your best interest to go. Lectures are the only way you learn (& weekly discussion questions) and it's through ppnt. It's an easy B if you just show up and listen. He's obviously very passionate about his class and actually says actually a lot, but we love him sm!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Tests? Not many--Amazing lectures

comment: Discussion post each week, but very easy. 4 tests, multiple choice online on lockdown browser and in class written portion. Everything on the tests are on the powerpoints he shows in class but he doesn't post them on D2L. No attendance policy so just find a friend to get the notes from.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY--Would take again

comment: TAKE PROFESSOR BAILEY! He is an awesome professor and very passionate about the material. He is very laid back and has a great sense of humor. Everything you need to know for the test are on the powerpoint, he literally highlights the most important parts. With that being said, do not miss class because he does not post the powerpoints online.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures--Would take again

comment: Class has weekly discussion post, if you do it you get a 100 pretty much. Test are webcam lockdown multiple choice but study highlighted terms and you will be fine lowest I made other than three 100s was 96. Four test part the multiple choice and part short answer in class, very easy highlighted on power point or key themes.
rating_tags: Tests? Not many--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Take his class he is such a genuine guy really wants his students to succeed and really loves what he does and teachers so he makes the class entertaining I made an easy 100% recommend him awesome lectures and very fair tests

BEST CLASS EVER. Just write down everything on his powerpoints, which isn't much, and you've basically got the test. He has weekly discussion posts that are super easy (made 100s on all of them). He really loves history and has so many cool stories to tell. I would definitely take him again if I had the chance. 10/10

Prof. Bailey is charismatic who happens to say "actually" a lot. Classes consist of ppts with key points & pictures so it's mainly jotting down notes. There are dq's due every Sunday and aren't difficult, as for exams they consist of about 25 mult choice with lockdown browser. I would suggest study groups & quizlets to pass, overall great professor

Prof. Bailey is amazing. His class is easy as long as you study your notes. He highlighted the terms that might be in the test. It is better if you come to class because he did not post his presentation. Just make quizlet from the term and study from your notes as well, you will get easy A.
He is such a great professor and I recommend him to everyone... Even though it is history, he makes it pretty interesting and he gives great lectures

Professor Bailey is lecture heavy. Weekly discussion posts. Has highlighted terms for each powerpoint. Need to know only highlighted terms for tests. His test are two parts, part multiple choice and part free response. Not a bad professor at all definitely recommend
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--TEST HEAVY

comment: I usually really dislike any type of history class but I genuinely enjoyed his class. Weekly discussion questions arent hard and if you do them before they are due you have a chance to redo them if you dont like your grade. I took summer semester so it was a lot of info in a short amount of time but I would 100% recommend taking his class.

Hands down best professor I've had at KSU! Every week there is an 8-10 sentence discussion question about an article, but all the articles are interesting and he just asks your opinion. He highlights what is on the test in the lecture, and he means it when he says thats whats on the test. Tests are online with camera so no open book tests.

Love this guy! He is humorous and kind. He makes history really interesting.  The tests are online and the written portion you have to complete in class. Very easy class. Just make sure to go to each class. He does not post the powerpoints, so make sure to take good notes. He will tell you what is on the tests from the presentations.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious--Amazing lectures

comment: BEST PROFESSOR AT KSU! Take notes on his power point slides and make sure you write down the highlighted terms. The tests are only over the highlighted terms! Very straight forward and he is so funny! Weekly discussion posts and 4 tests. Don't buy the book. Try to come to class everyday so you have all the notes. I wish I could take him again!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: He is an excellent professor for history as he makes the lectures of potentially boring material very interesting through his passion for the subject matter, as well as his comedic ability. I never used the book and made an A. He highlights the information he tests you on on his slides, so get those key terms, do the discussion questions.
You have weekly homework and 4 tests. He is really cool and likes what he teaches. Attendance isn't mandatory but he does not post the PowerPoints on D2L. Really cool guy!

Definitely a wonderful professor. The class is lecture based, but it's hard to avoid that in a 200 person class and makes it quite interesting. Funny, accessible outside of class, and will definitely work with you to make sure you pass. It's an easy A if you show up, but he doesn't take attendance.
He's enjoyable to take. Discussion questions every week but easy to do. Tests taken exactly from lecture notes. I would take him again.

He stands up front every day and lectures about things that make you want to fall asleep. He doesn't post the lectures on D2L so make sure you have a friend that can send you the notes if you miss. Every Sunday at midnight you will have a discussion post due over some articles that he posts on d2l the previous week. He doesnt drop the lowest grade.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: This class consisted of 4 exams and a discussion question each week to do online that was due every Sunday evening. His lectures are clear and it is easy to understand the info. He gives one optional extra credit assignment. The multiple choice part of the exams were done online and we had short answer for the test in class.

One of my favorite professors. Everything that will be on tests is highlighted on his presentations so you HAVE to go to class and HAVE to take notes. But he makes it very interesting and it wasn't a pain at all. Study your notes for the tests and it will be an easy and enjoyable class
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: He was awesome! Very caring, always gave his view on topics. Attendance isn't necessarily mandatory but it's important to go because anything highlighted in yellow on the powerpoint is the only things on the exam and not posted on d2l. 4 exams; multiple choice is online; written portion of exam in class, & 15 weekly discussion questions. Easy A.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: Easy class for an honors students. Tests were almost word for word from presentations.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--EXTRA CREDIT--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Great teacher. However, I really struggled with his test. Multiple choice is online through video lockdown browser and he does check it. I failed most of them. Usually, I do much better on written parts, but I failed those too. Three of my friends were in this class and they struggled too. Not sure why there aren't more reviews of struggling people
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: I had heard so many great things about this professor before I took him. I don't know if it was the 300+ students we had in the class or what, but we just did not click. I found it hard to pay attention most of the time. He's a really really nice guy but his tests were hard for me and I struggled most of the semester. Give him a try though.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Inspirational--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Great professor! Attendance isn't mandatory but it's important to go as the tests come straight from the powerpoints (anything highlighted in yellow on the powerpoint will be on the exam)! Multiple choice is online; written portion of exam is in class. Weekly discussion questions due Sunday. Easy A!
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: One of the best professors I have taken. I love history and he does as well. Class is not mandatory, however he will not release his PowerPoint slides if you were absent. He will show them to you if you make an appointment during his office hours and you can also get a buddy. Overall, I absolutely loved him and would take him again in a heartbeat.

He is an awesome lecturer. I could listen to him talk all day. Gives weekly discussion questions for easy 25 pts, Tests come from his slides/lectures. But you have to study! Gives extra credit also an easy A. He cares about his students and is always willing to answer any questions. TAKE HIM, you won't regret it.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Kent Bailey is one of the best at KSU. I had such a great time in class and he made the lectures so interesting. If you study only the highlighted material you will surely get an A. He wants to make an impact on your life which I think is rare at KSU.

Took an 8 am class.  Not hard, easy to find parking.  If you don't come to class, you won't pass.  Didn't buy a book, didn't need to.  Everything you need comes from lectures, so come  class.  If you need to miss class, TALK TO HIM, and he will work with you.

SUPER easy class!! I am not a fan of history and he underlines exactly what will be on the test through his powerpoint! He gives a discussion post every week which takes me maybe ten min. He is super understanding and goes off a point system, one of my favorite classes in college. And there are quizlets to help study for every test.

Great professor and even a better person.  He impacts your life by not just teaching you new material but opening up your perspective on the little things in life.  Easy A, entertaining, and a class that does not require much work.  He is a fair guy.

From Marietta Campus student: He a great lecturer and I really enjoyed his class. Even though it took me 20 mins driving to KC for 8 am class, his class is totally worth it! Four simple and easy exams if you take notes and study only the highlighted keywords from his lecture. there are weekly readings. Take him if you can! Guaranteed an A!
Nice professor, easy class. Make sure to take notes every lecture and you'll do just fine.

Notes aren't available outside of class so attendance is mandatory. 250 people in a lecture so you will be constantly receiving emails asking for notes. Powerpoints are very direct and easy to follow with test material highlighted. Exams are 2 parts: free response taken in class, multiple choice at home. No homework. Good and reasonable prof overal

Kent Bailey is awesome!! His lectures are extremely easy to follow. Go to class because he doesn't put his powerpoints online but he highlights key terms for the tests. There are discussions each week that are due by Sunday night, and those are easy 100's. For tests, the multiple choice is online and the essay portion is in class. Really nice guy!

Amazing! Take him, he is a great guy in person and loves what he teaches! Test are tough, you just need good notes and listen. So definitely go to class. And don't you dare get the textbook never used it.

Awesome professor! He is incredibly helpful and cool. I recommend talking to him and reviewing with him during his office hours. He helped me so much to understand the material. I also have a test taking problem so he helped me understand how the exams are set up so how to study and prepare. HIGHLY recommend him as a professor for this class.

Best history professor I've had at KSU. He is super funny, very well educated on his subject, and definitely loves his job. He makes it clear that he is there for you if you need help. Definitely take him! He is excited about teaching history. He doesn't take attendance, but you won't do well on tests if you skip lecture. Don't buy the book.

I love Professor Bailey! He really knows how to keep you interested in World History and really knows the ins and outs of historical events. He will sometimes show us short videos that relate to the subject and those are interesting as well. Tests are easy, even with the short answer proportion. He makes it very clear what will be on the test.

Very cool teacher, helpful, keeps things interesting and straightforward. 3 exams and a final,  one discussion question on D2L due once a week. Book isnt requred and classtime is used to take notes off of a powerpoint, tests are formed straight from the notes, multiple choice and a few short answer. Doesn't really like when people get up and leave.

TAKE HIM! Quirky, knowledgable  professor. 4 tests with weekly online discussions. Has a way of presenting material that is relatable and understandable to the younger generation plus  his life experiences, logical opinion, and quick movie/documentary snippets keep your attention. EASY A! Take notes on highlighted items in Powerpoint presentation!!

Great professor!! He doesn't post any of the powerpoints online, so attendance is extremely important. He says on the first day that he will highlight anything important in the powerpoints that will be on the test, so as long as you take notes in class, the tests will be super easy! I don't even like history, but I loved this class!

Bailey the best professor for this class. His lectures are interesting and he highlights exactly what's going to be on the test in his powerpoints. The tests are easy if you study the highlighted things in his lectures. An easy A if you do all of the discussion questions. Don't forget to do them, if you miss too many, it adds up.

One of my favorite teachers by far.  He knows his stuff and makes the class fun.  He loves to joke around and also talk about his life.  He's not afraid to disagree with things that the government has done.  He takes attendance even though it isn't mandatory.  If you go to his class and pay attention, you'll get a good grade.

I've never really been a history person but Mr. Bailey is AMAZING! He makes the lectures really interesting and he's always making jokes. He isn't afraid to tell you his own opinion and even asks for our opinion even with a room of 160+ students. His tests are super easy if you come to class, 4 tests, no final & weekly posts. would def take again!!

He is a really funny guy. The entire class is spent going through power points but it doesn't feel like a lecture. Attendance isn't required but if you miss class, you won't know whats on the test unless you ask a class mate for notes. 4 tests

This guy will not stop saying "once again". I swear i counted him saying that 80 times in class. Other than that, his class is easy and the only way you can't make at least a B is if you don't study ever. Just study and come to class. its not that hard. get ready to hear "once again" over and over

LOVE HIM! He gives great lectures and he is very funny. He is so passionate about teaching. He makes the information easy to understand. I have never liked history but Professor Bailey made me love it when I took his class. His tests are easy if you study, and he really cares about your success in his class.

I loved Professor Bailey! He makes the material interesting by adding humor. He's hilarious so I actually enjoy going to class. Attendance isn't mandatory but he takes note at the end of the semester when it comes to bumping grades. Weekly discussion posts are easy and theres only four exams which come from the slides in class. Super Easy A!

Kent Bailey is AWESOME. Coming from a person who dreads history, I looked forward to going to his class everytime. He is so funny and his lectures are very interesting. He bolds words in powerpoint that will be on the test. Show up, take notes, and study; its a fun A.

His class isn't extremely difficult, but it requires work. There are weekly readings and discussion questions. They make you think, but they are doable. The tests really aren't bad, however they can be challenging because there is a short answer portion. He doesn't post powerpoints, so you must attend class.

He's a pretty funny guy. 4 test (25 Q + 5 Short answer) and 15 discussion questions. Take notes. Do not buy the book. Do all discussion questions. If you fail a test, talk to him. No extra credit. Test aren't cumulative. Does not make it clear what is on the test, so know everything.

The lectures can get kind of long, but he keeps it interesting. Plus, his humor really helps you stay focused. There is a weekly discussion question which adds up to the equivalency of two tests. The tests are kind of hard because there is a lot of material. But if you take notes everyday and study them, you'll be fine.

Great professor and guy. You have to study for the test though. He knows his stuff, really funny. For having this class at 8 am, it was actually worth getting up for because it was my favorite class of this semester. Go to class to get notes, attendance, and sometimes he will give you extra credit for being there. One of my favorite professors.

Great teacher. No study guides for the 4 tests. No final. Only other assignments are 1 discussion question a week. Never used my textbook, the only time I had to read was for the discussions but he posts links with the readings. I suck at history but I managed to pass his class by studying the day of the tests. Cool guy

Professor Bailey is really funny (avoid if you're offended) and so helpful. His lectures were also very interesting.  I really didn't use the textbook, so I don't recommend purchasing it. Just attend class every day and take good notes.

Although, his lectures are long (like every other history class), he is an HILARIOUS teacher that I would take AGAIN. Class is mandatory if you want to pass since he does not post his powerpoints on D2l. Instead, he highlights ALL terms you need to know for test so show up, keep note, and you will make an EASY A. He is awesome and keeps class FUN.

Its easy to take notes for this class. I only used my book once or twice for the online  discussion questions due every Sunday. You have to come to class to get notes, because he doesn't post it online. If you do questions, and study your notes you should easily get  a decent grade. Not hard! He does take role to see if you make effort to come.

Bailey is the nicest person you'll ever meet. He tries his best to make class fun for everyone. His lectures are great and his exams are straightforward. He does take attendance but going to class everyday wasn't a problem. He doesn't post his lectures online and there are discussion questions every week. But it's a simple class and he made is fun.

He is AWESOME! Fun and funny person and lectures. Easy tests if you go to class. Might be the only history class in my life that has made me actually like history and learn something meaningful. He made me actually consider switching my nursing major to history! CRAZY! I don't even like history! That is how awesome he is!
Don't skip class, notes are really helpful. If you put the effort in you will make an A. Funny and nice professor, plenty of chances for extra credit.

So here's the deal. 4 tests, they all weigh equal. First one easy as pie. Second is a little tough but you can pull it off if you study the right material. Third and Fourth are both easy. If you study you will be fine! His personality is great and will make you laugh. He makes the class a little bit more bearable! (:

The best professor I've taken a class with here, he loves the subject which makes him awesome; tests come directly from the notes, tests are super easy, lectures are interesting and fun, makes class worth going to, wish he taught more courses! Shows hilarious videos in class that relate. He LOVES the 80's. Wout a book, I made an A, just take notes
He's super funny and nice. His test are REALLY REALLY easy but they are not easy if you don't study. I HATE history but he deff made it bearable. Take him. You won't regret it.
Do not skip! Tests are easy if you take the time to study. The book wasn't necessary, but it was helpful if you didn't take notes.

Professor Bailey is seriously the coolest! Sometimes his lectures drag, but he is really good at putting interesting material within the lectures. He loves showing funny video clips to break up the lectures. His test are really easy too. You can tell he is really passionate about history, which makes him such a great teacher.

Hilarious! Best history professor I've had at KSU. His class was so easy if you show up and do the weekly discussion posts. He loves to joke around and engage with the class. Works with you if you have any issues. Please take his class.

History is my least favorite subject but it definitely didn't feel like it this semester. He is an incredible teacher and he sets you up to succeed. I wish I had gone to class more often because the powerpoints outline just about everything you need to know for the test. He's really funny and down to earth.

If you show up for class and take notes on his powerpoint lectures (he will bold words that will be on the tests-be sure to highlight those or something), you'll be totally prepared for the test.  The textbook isn't needed at all. Be sure to do the weekly discussion questions, but they're really easy.

I really enjoyed Professor Bailey this semester. Although i dread history, I didn't mind his class. He is very helpful, wants to see his students succeed, and if you have a question he is very approachable & is quick in responding to emails. Weekly discussion questions, and 4 tests. If you study the notes it should be an easy A
Mr. Bailey is a very passionate teacher, who managed to make my least favorite subject somewhat interesting. Just study the colored terms, and you'll make an A.
Easy class, passionate and fun teacher, and you don't need to be there to get an A. Use the bolded words from the powerpoint. Offers bonus points on tests about things he talks about in class.

One of the best professors here! His tests are super easy, but I learned so much in his class. We would have open lectures and debate different topics. He loves history and tells a lot of funny personal stories. Take him!
Great Teacher. Read the PowerPoints for his tests.
Very easy professor. Lectures are pretty interesting and he is very open to differing thoughts and opinions. Uploads every ppt and marks are important terms for the test.
